channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023120474
item.description:
Report E-2023120474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1789 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Compliance Technologies (ACT) to remediate the impacted site. ACT personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted trailer floor and soil under the trailer. Crews tightened the bung and the leak stopped. Crews secured the drum upright to the trailer wall and the driver continued on to the terminal. Utilizing hand tools, the ACT crew was able to excavate the impacted soil. All impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was taken by ACT.

item.title: Report E-2023120459
item.description:
Report E-2023120459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately half a gallon of battery acid (UN2794) was released from one forklift battery after it fell over. The release impacted the trailer and concrete. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and after speaking to the service center manager it was determined that terminal staff are capable of cleaning the release with PPE on site. (1) 65-gallon poly drum containing battery acid, PPE, and Oil Dri was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • City: TAMPA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The steel drum arrived to the station already wet. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The steel drum of Hexanes was found dented and punctured causing it to leak. The shipped did not use a shipping box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival, the steel drum was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023120917
item.description:
Report X-2023120917

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: PALMETTO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was picked up from a driver on the day of 12/14/23 and brought back to the station. Upon arrival of QA Calvin Pudela (12/15/23 @ 12:00PM), a noticeable odor of alcohol was coming from the pail. Upon further investigation of the HAZMAT Pail, I covered the opening with tape so I could test if the seal was actually broken or not. Once I flipped the pail over, I noticed that there was a slight amount of liquid coming out. Then I started my processing of HAZMAT package. DescribePack: There is a cap built into the top cap for the pail of denatured alcohol. The cap appears to have been opened and no longer seems to close/seal. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: I taped the cap of the pail opening to avoid anymore of the smell escaping.

item.title: Report E-2023120416
item.description:
Report E-2023120416

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 19, 2023, one (1) 5-liter jug of hydrogen peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released less than three (<3) liters of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the hydrogen peroxide-impacted trailer interior/dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged jug were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023121009
item.description:
Report X-2023121009

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: GROVELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/15/2023 at approximately 1345 , Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 68727 at the station location in Groveland, reporting a herbicide spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic container that shipped inside of a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking, initially the cause was unknown. The shipment was discovered leaking during delivery and was returned to the station, Further investigation revealed that the top was not secure on the bottle, causing the spillage. An online safety data sheet was located by Dangerous Goods Administration and it revealed that the commodity was classified as a regulated corrosive shipment, though not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.
